item.title: Report X-2025071332
item.description:
Report X-2025071332

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A LEAKING HAZMAT WAS DISCOVERED ON DOOR 10 UNLOAD. THE RESPONDER USED ALL NECESSARY PPE AND RESPONSE SHEETS WHILE CLEANING UP THE SPILL. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP ARE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING AS WHICH TIME THE FUMES COMING FROM THE PACKAGE BECAME TOO INTENSE AND IT WAS MOVED OUTSIDE ON A PUSH CART FOR VENTILATION. OUTSIDE RESPONDERS WERE CALLED FOR FINAL DISPOSITION OF THE PACKAGE.

item.description:

  • City: LENEXA

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE, CONSULTED WITH THE DECISION TREE WHICH LED TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER CLEANED UP SPILL ACCORDING TO RESPONSE SHEET AND BROUGHT LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2025070133
item.description:
Report X-2025070133

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-01
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWO AIR PACKAGES WERE INSPECTED AFTER BEEPING WAS HEARD COMING FROM BOTH PACKAGES. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE BOX CONTAINS SIX SIGMA SPECTRUM INFUSION PUMPS. THE SECOND PACKAGE UNDER TRACKING NUMBER 1Z66906E2210032466 CONTAINS FIVE SPECTRUM INFUSION PUMPS. THE INFUSION PUMPS CONTAIN INSTALLED LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THERE WAS NO PROTECTION AGAINST MOVEMENT OR ACCIDENTAL ACTIVATION DURING TRANSPORTATION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025071058
item.description:
Report X-2025071058

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-26
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Ten loaded tank cars derailed in various positions while being pulled from the Purefield Ingredients facility in Russell, KS. Derailed cars, from the east are: PROX 45676 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright between the rails TILX 199959 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright between the rails TILX 199969 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? on its top TCIX 3172 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed, manway 45 degrees down to the ground CTCX 303037 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed, manway 45 degrees down to the ground UTLX 212781 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 212951 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 208685 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on right side UTLX 213152 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed on left side UTLX 212993 (load alcohols, N.O.S) ? derailed upright Inspection of the derailment found approximately five gallons of product released from both UTLX 208685 and UTLX 213152. Product evaporated, no remediation required.

item.title: Report X-2025070462
item.description:
Report X-2025070462

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-25
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT DECLARED PACKAGE FOUND LEAKING. RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. REPSONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND THE LEAKER OUTSIDE UNLOAD DOOR 14. RESPONDER CONSULTED WITH THE DECSION TREE WHICH LED TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL ACCORDING TO THE GUIDLINES IN RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER BROUGHT BACK LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF.

  • City: WICHITA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: UNLOADER NOTICED GROUND HAZMAT LEAKING PACKAGE AT BOTTOM OF WALL IN TRAILER THAT HAD BEEN LOADED WITH ORIENTATION ARROWS SIDEWAYS AND IRREGS STACKED ON TOP. DOUBLE WALLED CORRUGATED, PARTITIONS PROTECTING 4 GALLON BOTTLES. EACH BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED. THE LID FROM ONE BOTTLE HAD COME LOOSE, SPILLING CONTENTS.

item.title: Report E-2025070418
item.description:
Report E-2025070418

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 00:52 AM ET, XKC contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Kansas City, KS. The spill consists of approximately 25 pounds of Sodium Nitrate Prills, which released from 350-pound plastic bags due to not being properly packaged by the shipper, causing them to tear during transit and spill onto the trailer floor. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed spill had already been cleaned up by XPO personnel of UN1498 Sodium Nitrate Prills product due to not being properly packaged by shipper. The damaged bags were containerized to an 85-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
